title: Angus Cloud, star of HBO's 'Euphoria,' dies at 25
description: Angus Cloud, a fan favorite from HBO's "Euphoria" series, has died at the age of 25, his family said in a statement Monday.

title: Biden opts to keep Space Command in Colorado, reversing Trump’s decision to move it to Alabama
description: President Biden has decided to keep Space Command headquarters in Colorado, reversing plans by President Trump to shift the headquarters to Alabama.

title: Paul Reubens helped usher in a surreal new era of comedy
description: Paul Reubens all but vanished from the public eye in the 1990s and 2000s. But in his absence, a rising generation of comic talents illustrated his influence was vast.

title: Lori Vallow Daybell receives multiple life sentences in murders of her 2 children and romantic rival
description: Lori Vallow Daybell received multiple life sentences in prison without the possibility of parole in the deaths of her two children and that of her husband’s previous wife, a case that drew national intrigue after her children disappeared nearly four years ago.

title: Paul Reubens, actor best known as Pee-wee Herman, dies at 70
description: Actor Paul Reubens, who came to fame in the 1980s as children's TV star Pee-wee Herman, has died years after a cancer diagnosis, his team said Monday.

title: Fan files police report after Cardi B hurled microphone into crowd during Las Vegas show
description: A woman who says she was hit by a microphone rapper Cardi B hurled into the crowd at a Las Vegas concert has filed a police report for battery, authorities say.

title: Netanyahu denies Israel is heading toward civil war as he calls judicial overhaul 'necessary'
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said his country is not heading toward civil war, following new legislation that severely weakens the Supreme Court.

title: Georgia judge rejects Trump bid to halt Fulton County election probe
description: A judge denied Donald Trump's attempt to halt Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis' investigation into efforts to overturn the 2020 election results in Georgia.

title: Twitter threatens legal action against nonprofit group that monitors hate speech
description: X Corp., the parent company of the social media app formerly known as Twitter, threatened a nonprofit organization with legal action.
